defined_commands.purpose: To quickly view the current project file hierarchy in a clean, visual format.
defined_commands.instruction: Provide the current project file listing in an ASCII format similar to the Linux tree command.

defined_commands.purpose: To freeze the current state of the project as a tagged reference for future comparison.
defined_commands.instruction: Signal the end of a version; confirm the tag value and seek explicit consent before snapshotting.

defined_commands.purpose: To automatically update the documentation data source when the project state changes.
defined_commands.instruction: Generate a new fully updated docs/readme_data.json file to reflect the latest state of the current version of the project.

defined_commands.purpose: To review all custom tools available in this session.
defined_commands.instruction: Show me a summarised output of all other specifically defined commands, along with a description, purpose and the instruction provided for each one.

defined_commands.purpose: To extract the command definitions in a machine-readable format for docs/commands.json.
defined_commands.instruction: Provide the output of the LIST command (command details) in JSON format.

defined_commands.purpose: To see a summarized breakdown of every file, including those in the /docs folder.
defined_commands.instruction: Provide a summarised output of all files in this current version of the project, along with a description and purpose.

defined_commands.purpose: To provide a high-level summary of the project's health and features.
defined_commands.instruction: Provide a summary of the status of this version of the project. Include a description, purpose, and a summary of the key features.
